title: Democratic Rep. John Yarmuth Won’t Seek Re-Election
sub_head: Chairman of House Budget Committee has played central role in advancing President Biden’s agenda
body:
Rep. John Yarmuth, the chairman of the House Budget Committee and a central figure in advancing President Biden’s agenda through Congress, said on Tuesday that he wouldn’t run for re-election next year.
First elected to the House in 2006, Mr. Yarmuth (D., Ky.) represents what is currently a safely blue seat in the Louisville area. As the chairman of the budget panel, he has been closely involved in crafting both the $1.9 trillion coronavirus relief bill Democrats passed earlier this year and the broader social-policy and climate bill the party is currently working on.
